Job Title: Plant Manager

Location: Southern, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Title: Plant ManagerLocation: Southern VirginiaPosition Summary:The Plant Manager is a key leadership role responsible for overseeing the efficient and safe operations of a manufacturing facility. This position requires a dynamic individual with exceptional management and operational skills to ensure the plant meets production targets, maintains product quality, adheres to safety standards, and maximizes cost-efficiency. The Plant Manager plays an important role in maintaining and enhancing the overall success of the facility.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:• Safety and Compliance:o Maintain a culture of safety and compliance with all relevant regulations and guidelines.o Monitor and promote safe work practices and conduct regular safety audits.• Quality Control:o Implement and enforce strict quality control measures to ensure that products meet or exceed industry and company standards.o Investigate and address any quality issues promptly to prevent recurrence.• Inventory and Supply Chain Management:o Manage raw material and finished goods inventory to optimize stock levels and reduce excess holding costs.o Collaborate with the supply chain team to ensure timely and cost-effective material procurement.• Production Management:o Develop and execute production plans to meet or exceed output targets while maintaining product quality and efficiency.o Implement continuous improvement strategies to enhance production processes and reduce waste.• Budgeting and Cost Management:o Develop and manage the plant's budget, monitoring expenses and identifying cost-saving opportunities.o Optimize resource allocation and cost-effective production processes.• Team Leadership:o Recruit, train, and develop a high-performing team.o Foster a collaborative and engaged workforce, setting clear expectations, and providing regular feedback.• Maintenance and Equipment:o Oversee maintenance schedules and equipment reliability to minimize downtime.o Ensure that all equipment is in optimal working condition and coordinate repairs when necessary.• Environmental Stewardship:o Implement environmentally responsible practices, minimizing the plant's environmental footprint.o Comply with relevant environmental regulations and seek opportunities for sustainability improvements.• Communication and Reporting:o Maintain open and effective communication with senior management, employees, and other relevant stakeholders.o Provide regular reports on plant performance, including key performance indicators (KPIs).• Up to 15% travel may be required.

Experience Level (if available): Director
